Key Match Events: Andrew Wiggins scored a game-high 29 points and made a game-best five 3-pointers
The Warriors lost Stephen Curry to an ankle injury in the fourth quarter
Wiggins scored at least nine points in three different quarters
The Clippers had a 20-point advantage in paint points (58-38)
Buddy Hield hit a baseline jumper and then sank a deep three, converting a 4-point play
Trayce Jackson-Davis received an alley-oop slam from Buddy Hield
Kevon Looney recorded a double-double with 10 points and 11 rebounds
Post-Match Reflections: POSTGAME WARRIORS TALK: Gary Payton II and Moses Moody provided post-game reflections
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers went on an 11-0 run in the second quarter
Harden shot just 6-for-19 from the field but recorded a double-double with 23 points and 11 assists
